name: Crowne Plaza Moncton Downtown

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza during a recent business convention in November 2013. My first issue was that our group rate was the same as the regular rate (though I believe that blame falls on my company's event organizer and their lack of negotiating that that of the hotel itself). The meeting area was good; it was clean and well equipped, and the staff did an exception job attending the beverages/lunches and cleaning up. My three interactions with staff was very pleasant, with all actively engaging me in pleasant conversation. My room, which was on the third floor, was generally clean however there was a large stain on the rug in the center of the room. The bed provided a very nice sleep and I had no issue/concern with the cleanliness of the bed and/or linen. I heard almost no noise from exterior of the room. The bathroom was also clean as well as bright and well stocked. While there was plenty of hot water, the pressure from the shower head was poor (no issue with the pressure from the faucets - need new shower heads?). One downfall might be that the bathroom offers no ventilation fan. The in-room internet (wired/wifi) was very good!! The hotel offers onsite fitness rooms, pool with hot tub and an enclosed parking garage. Plus, an onsite barber shop for those of us guys in need of a hair cut before the big meeting. Yes, the hotel is older and I have stayed at the hotel when it operated under different flags. While the hotel's age does pop up here and there, the Crowne Plaza group has done a very good job maintaining the hotel, plus the renovations over the years has certainly helped this hotel keep with industry trends and expectations. I would have no issue returning to this hotel in the future. Many thanks!
reviews.title: Downtown Hotels Continues to Deliver

reviews.text: I called to book as part of a convention who blocked out rooms at the hotel, they said those rooms were full but I booked in anyway at the full rate. I called to cancel and they ended up giving me the rate to keep me. (why not just give the rate to begin with) ..but they apologized and were confused as to why i wasn't just given the rate. who knows... but I'm glad I stayed because the place was great! I even got a huge room with two queen beds, even though I said one queen was fine. The staff were so friendly and helpful and there was plenty of parking and it was a great location. It was very quiet. We ordered room service and it was delicious, the beds were very very comfortable and the room and the bathroom were huge. It was walking distance to pretty much anything we could want downtown. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to others
reviews.title: Great staff, great room and perfect location

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel in a central location - close to many pubs and eating establishments. staff was courteous and helpful with maps and rental cars --- call the National Rent A Car office not far from the motel and save some moey over the airport locations -- the weekend rates were fantastic
reviews.title: First trip to the Maritimes

reviews.text: I found this hotel to be worn-out, tired and in desperate need of a complete renovation. The staff seems very pleasant, but I don’t think anyone can clean out the imbedded dirt and stains at this point. The beds are really nothing fantastic and to make it worse, my room smelled musty. If I had a choice between going back and sleeping in my car, I’d take the car. It is in a good location, but I can’t really write anything else positive about this hotel. I will be heading back through the Maritimes for business next month and I will definitely not be staying at the Crowne Plaza again. Yuck.
reviews.title: yuck ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in mid Sepember 2013. There were many great things for this hotel such as the location as you are walking distance to both coffee shops and restaurants. Although the hotel restaurant is convenient and the food is good we only stayed for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a night on our way East. The hotel is about two blocks from the edge of downtown, and as of August 2013 they are working on their parking garage. The lobby has been updated, and it seems like they may be updating some floors of rooms.
reviews.title: Aging Hotel

reviews.text: I would stay at the hotel if I were driving through again, but the Delta hotel is closer to the restaurants and bars downtown.
reviews.title: Friendliest reception staff in all New Brunswick
Ok for an overnighter
reviews.text: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Moncton for 1 night as part of a tour of New Brunswick last week and I have to say that the front of house staff were amazingly friendly and helpful especially when I needed my phone charging and broke the travel adaptor! The rooms were comfortable with all the facilities that I needed and the restaurant service was very quick and friendly in the evening with a good selection of wine available at reasonable cost. When we went downstairs for breakfast we received very attentive service from the waitress who kept me topped up with coffee which was much appreciated!! Breakfast was of a good standard and plentiful with buffet style service. I would definitely stay here again

After checkin mid afternoon we went for a walk to find a restaurant for dinner . The area was rough to say the least and intimidating even in daylight. Needless to say we ate in the hotel which was pretty dismal. The room was a standard chain hotel - characterless but clean.
reviews.title: Everything We Could Want

reviews.text: We were visiting family in Moncton and we didn't have a car, so the Crowne Plaza was perfect for us. We could walk to food and coffee. The rooms were huge, and quiet. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. When we first arrived, there was a problem with the toilet. Someone arrived to fix it within 5 minutes, he brought the supplies he needed and had it fixed promptly.
reviews.title: Perfect for Downtown

reviews.text: The staff are exceptional! I was greeted by Nadja Uriyo every time I walked in and she remembered my name each time after my initial check-in. She made me feel welcome and pampered. Julien Jans was very friendly and we chatted at my check-out time. He made me feel as if I were leaving new found friends. Derek Leblanc, the concierge, was always there for help and assistance, and again, I was always greeted by name and with a wonderful smile. I knew that all I had to do was ask and he would be there to assist me. It was a comfortable stay in all aspects, but the staff's attentiveness was remarkable. Good Job!
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff

reviews.text: Firstly, the good things!
reviews.title: Noise of hot water pipes (or something) in the room was terrible!

reviews.text: Great sized rooms, extremely comfortable beds, lovely little packages to help you sleep, good sized shower and bathroom. I ordered out from a local restaurant for dinner, and that wasn't a hassle at all.
reviews.title: No Monc-y Business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were pleasant at check in.
reviews.title: Best sleep

reviews.text: However - 2 things were pretty irritating, especially as this hotel prides itself on the sleep quality - there was a really bad noise in our room. It was worst in the bathroom, but you could hear it throughout the rest of the room aswell. I think it was the hot water pipes or something, and it drove me insane. Why didn't I ask to change rooms? Good question - I'm sure they would have changed us, but we checked in late, on the back of a day of 10 hours driving. It was midnight, I was already in bed and had 3 suitcases. No way could I be bothered changing rooms.
reviews.title: Quick Fun Family Fun

reviews.text: I stayed the night of September 9th and 10th 2013. The staff at the front desk are very professional and (maybe because I'm a Platinum member) upgraded me in a 1 Bedroom Kids Suite with Jacuzzi, room 521. Although I was by myself I have really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere and quite environment. The bed was super comfort and also enjoyed the Jacuzzi, which you can see from a glass window through the bedroom.
reviews.title: Great hospitality, very comfortable room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also located in Main Street and few minutes walking from the City Center with all the best Restaurants etc. It is only 10 min away from the Airport.
reviews.title: No complaints!

reviews.text: I would definitely go back there if I happen to travel in Moncton NB area.
reviews.title: Would recommend for Moncton

reviews.text: The staff was great! Plus we were given an upgrade to a king bed with a couch chairs TV area and breakfast. The room was excellent and the breakfast top quality. The upgrade was a smart move because you have satisfied customers who just wrote a 5* review of your hotel and will consider you first on their next visit because we had a good experience at a better price than other hotels which offer similar service.
reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room appears relatively clean but bathroom toiletteries were were half used; the (new) Temple Spa sleep tight package was unique and much welcomed especially after a long road trip; parking lot sucks if you have heavy luggage because you may have to lug it with stairs (there are no elevators, so it's either stairs or walk on the car path)!! You have to pay $10 for overnight parking and honestly if they are renovating their parkade and given how inconvenient it is, parking really should be complimentary. Hotel dated but the lower price makes that part up; they do have noise issues with young party-ers it seems like but they attend to complaints promptly. Laura the assistant manager was pleasant and had great customer service whereas the other front desk personnel were average at best.
reviews.title: Great stay in downtown Moncton

aka: Crowne Plaza Moncton Downtown Hotel Moncton
description: Located in downtown Moncton, close to local shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. A full-service 4 1/2 star hotel with 14 meeting rooms, an in-door pool, onsite restaurant, free wireless internet,24 hour fitness facility, and 24 hour business centre.
